result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Werch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $350 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to begin a technical college education toward obtaining an Associate's Degree.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to take all prescribed medication as ordered by treating physician. Defendant to comply with any and all terms in the Waushara County CSP/CCS Program.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. Sentence to commence within the first six months of probation.

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1 with the exception of the jail time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Werch

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea/Sentencign Hearing - February 23, 2015 - Original Transcript Housed in 2014CF000116

ADDRESS INFO for Michael M Werch
Current: 107 Professional Plaza - Apt. #7, Neenah, WI 54956 United States  (Effective: 04-24-2015)
Prior: N638 County Road X, Berlin, WI 54923
from the DE's mother to the Court
from DE's treatment providers and drug testing results

Case called @ 2:14 p.m. Defendant Michael M Werch in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - Guilty.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14TR1447, 1448 & 1478 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Ct 1 only - 25 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 2 days CFTS - Sentence to commence within the first six months of probation. As to both counts - DE to begin a techincal college education toward obtaining an associate's degree, DE to take all prescribed medication as ordered by treating physician, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DE to comply with the any and all terms in the Waushara County CSP & CCS programs, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.

14TR1477: Plea - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court orders: $800 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP, Blood draw cost $42.50 w/ 60 DTP or PP, 8 month DL revocation, OWI Assessment. No IID required.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Michael M Werch in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Roberts-Turner requesting signature bond. Court orders $350 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
